wrapper_tool.name: associate_asset_with_campaign

description.tagline: Associate a specified asset with a HubSpot campaign.
description.detailed: This tool is used to link various asset types such as forms, lists, or emails with a specific HubSpot campaign. It's useful for managing and organizing marketing efforts across different platforms.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Confirmation of the asset-campaign association.

arguments.name: campaign_unique_identifier
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the campaign, formatted as a UUID. Essential for associating an asset with the correct campaign.

arguments.name: asset_type
arguments.description: Specify the asset type to associate with the campaign. Allowed values are FORM, OBJECT_LIST, and EXTERNAL_WEB_URL.

arguments.name: asset_id
arguments.description: The unique identifier for the asset to be associated with a campaign. This should be provided as a string.

api_endpoints.description:
Associate a specified asset with a campaign. Using the API, you can create and remove associations for the following asset types: forms, static lists, external website pages, sequences, meetings, playbooks, feedback surveys, podcast episodes, sales documents, marketing emails, case studies, knowledge base articles, calls, and CTAs. 

For other asset types, it is recommended to manage your associations directly in the campaign tool in HubSpot.

Important: Currently, only the following asset types are available for association via the API: FORM, OBJECT_LIST, EXTERNAL_WEB_URL

api_endpoints.description:
Retrieve detailed information about the budget and spend items for a specified campaign, including the total budget, total spend, and remaining budget.
Budget and Spend items may be returned in any order, but the order field specifies their sequence based on the creation date. The item with order 0 is the oldest, and items with higher order values are newer

api_endpoints.name: post-/marketing/v3/campaigns/batch/read

wrapper_tool.name: fetch_marketing_campaign_batches

description.tagline: Retrieve a batch of HubSpot marketing campaigns and assets.
description.detailed: Use this tool to read a batch of marketing campaigns from HubSpot, along with their associated assets. The tool allows for processing up to 50 campaigns per request. Note that the campaigns returned may not be in the order requested, and duplicate campaign IDs will be handled by returning only unique entries.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: A list of marketing campaigns with associated assets.

arguments.name: campaign_batch_inputs
arguments.description: A list of JSON objects, each containing an 'id' key, representing the campaign IDs to fetch. Supports up to 50 campaigns per request.

arguments.name: fetch_start_date
arguments.description: Start date to fetch asset metrics, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. Determines the period for asset metrics. Optional.

arguments.name: end_date_for_asset_metrics
arguments.description: End date to fetch asset metrics, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. If not provided, no asset metrics will be fetched.

arguments.name: requested_properties
arguments.description: Comma-separated list of properties to return in the response. Ignored if values are empty, resulting in an empty properties map if not specified.

api_endpoints.description:
This endpoint reads a batch of campaigns based on the provided input data and returns the campaigns along with their associated assets. 
The maximum number of items in a batch request is 50.
The campaigns in the response are not guaranteed to be in the same order as they were provided in the request.
If duplicate campaign IDs are provided in the request, duplicates will be ignored. The response will include only unique IDs and will be returned without duplicates.

query.name: startDate

value_schema.description: Start date to fetch asset metrics, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. This date is used to fetch the metrics associated with the assets for a specified period. If not provided, no asset metrics will be fetched.

query.description: Start date to fetch asset metrics, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. This date is used to fetch the metrics associated with the assets for a specified period. If not provided, no asset metrics will be fetched.

query.name: endDate

value_schema.description: End date to fetch asset metrics, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. This date is used to fetch the metrics associated with the assets for a specified period. If not provided, no asset metrics will be fetched.

query.description: End date to fetch asset metrics, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. This date is used to fetch the metrics associated with the assets for a specified period. If not provided, no asset metrics will be fetched.

query.name: properties

value_schema.description: A comma-separated list of the properties to be returned in the response. If any of the specified properties has empty value on the requested object(s), they will be ignored and not returned in response. If this parameter is empty, the response will include an empty properties map.

query.description: A comma-separated list of the properties to be returned in the response. If this parameter is empty, the response will include an empty properties map.

wrapper_tool.name: get_marketing_campaigns

description.tagline: Retrieve a page of marketing campaigns with optional filters.
description.detailed: This tool allows retrieval of a page of marketing campaigns based on query parameters such as name filtering, sorting, and pagination. You can also control the properties included in the response.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: A page of marketing campaigns with specified filters.

arguments.name: sort_by
arguments.description: Specify the field to sort results by. Use '-' to denote descending order. Options are hs_name, createdAt, updatedAt. Default is hs_name.

arguments.name: pagination_cursor
arguments.description: A cursor for pagination. If provided, results start after the given cursor. Example: NTI1Cg%3D%3D

arguments.name: max_results_limit
arguments.description: Maximum number of campaigns to return (1-100). Default is 50.

arguments.name: campaign_name_filter
arguments.description: A substring to filter campaigns by name. Returns campaigns containing this substring. Optional: returns all if not provided.

arguments.name: requested_properties
arguments.description: A list of properties to be included in the response. Comma-separate values are required. If any specified property is empty, it will be ignored.

api_endpoints.description: This endpoint allows users to search for and return a page of campaigns based on various query parameters. Users can filter by name, sort, and paginate through the campaigns, as well as control which properties are returned in the response.

query.name: sort

value_schema.description:
The field by which to sort the results. Allowed values are hs_name, createdAt, updatedAt. An optional '-' before the property name can denote descending order
Default: hs_name

Default: 50

api_endpoints.description:
This endpoint deletes a batch of campaigns. 
The maximum number of items in a batch request is 50.
The response will always be 204 No Content, regardless of whether the campaigns exist or not, whether they were successfully deleted or not, or if only some of the campaigns in the batch were deleted.

description.detailed: Use this tool to get detailed information about a marketing campaign using its campaignGuid. It also provides information about associated assets, and if start and end dates are given, metrics for those assets.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Campaign information and asset metrics if available.

arguments.name: campaign_guid
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the campaign, formatted as a UUID.

arguments.name: metrics_start_date
arguments.description: Start date for fetching asset metrics. Format as YYYY-MM-DD. Metrics are only retrieved if both start and end dates are provided.

arguments.name: end_date_for_asset_metrics
arguments.description: End date to fetch asset metrics, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. If omitted, no metrics will be retrieved.

arguments.name: properties_list
arguments.description: List specific properties to return in the response. Leave empty for an empty properties map.

api_endpoints.description: Get a campaign identified by a specific campaignGuid with the given properties. Along with the campaign information, it also returns information about assets. Depending on the query parameters used, this can also be used to return information about the corresponding assets' metrics. Metrics are available only if startDate and endDate are provided.

query.name: startDate

value_schema.description:
Start date to fetch asset metrics, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. This date is used to fetch the metrics associated with the assets for a specified period.
If not provided, no asset metrics will be fetched.

query.description:
Start date to fetch asset metrics, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. This date is used to fetch the metrics associated with the assets for a specified period.
If not provided, no asset metrics will be fetched.

query.name: endDate

value_schema.description:
End date to fetch asset metrics, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. This date is used to fetch the metrics associated with the assets for a specified period.
If not provided, no asset metrics will be fetched.

query.description:
End date to fetch asset metrics, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. This date is used to fetch the metrics associated with the assets for a specified period.
If not provided, no asset metrics will be fetched.

query.name: properties

value_schema.description: A comma-separated list of the properties to be returned in the response. If any of the specified properties has empty value on the requested object, they will be ignored and not returned in response. If this parameter is empty, the response will include an empty properties map.

query.description: A comma-separated list of the properties to be returned in the response. If any of the specified properties has empty value on the requested object, they will be ignored and not returned in response. If this parameter is empty, the response will include an empty properties map.

api_endpoints.name: delete-/marketing/v3/campaigns/{campaignGuid}

wrapper_tool.name: delete_marketing_campaign

description.tagline: Delete a specified marketing campaign.
description.detailed: Use this tool to delete a marketing campaign from the system by providing the campaign's GUID. A 204 No Content response is returned, indicating the request was processed, regardless of whether the campaign existed.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Confirmation of campaign deletion request.

arguments.name: campaign_guid
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the campaign, formatted as a UUID.

api_endpoints.description:
Delete a specified campaign from the system.
This call will return a 204 No Content response regardless of whether the campaignGuid provided corresponds to an existing campaign or not.

path.name: campaignGuid

value_schema.description: Unique identifier for the campaign, formatted as a UUID.

path.description: Unique identifier for the campaign, formatted as a UUID.

api_endpoints.name: patch-/marketing/v3/campaigns/{campaignGuid}

wrapper_tool.name: update_campaign_properties

description.tagline: Update properties of a HubSpot marketing campaign.
description.detailed: Use this tool to perform a partial update of a marketing campaign in HubSpot by providing the campaignGuid and the new property values. Note that only existing, mutable properties can be updated; read-only and non-existent properties will cause an error. Passing an empty string will reset a property's value.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Updates details of a specified marketing campaign.

arguments.name: campaign_uuid
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the campaign, formatted as a UUID.

arguments.name: campaign_update_properties
arguments.description: A JSON object containing the properties with their new values. Include only mutable properties.

api_endpoints.description:
Perform a partial update of a campaign identified by the specified campaignGuid. Provided property values will be overwritten. Read-only and non-existent properties will cause 400 error.
If an empty string is passed for any property in the Batch Update, it will reset that property's value.

path.name: campaignGuid

value_schema.description: Unique identifier for the campaign, formatted as a UUID.

path.description: Unique identifier for the campaign, formatted as a UUID.

api_endpoints.name: get-/marketing/v3/campaigns/{campaignGuid}/reports/contacts/{contactType}

wrapper_tool.name: fetch_campaign_contact_ids

description.tagline: Fetch contact IDs for a specific campaign and contact type.
description.detailed: Use this tool to obtain the contact IDs associated with a particular marketing campaign and specified contact type in HubSpot. It is useful for analyzing campaign reach and engagement with specific contact demographics.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Returns a list of contact IDs for a specified campaign and contact type.

arguments.name: campaign_identifier
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the campaign formatted as a UUID.

arguments.name: contact_type_filter
arguments.description: Specifies the type of metric for filtering contacts. Options: contactFirstTouch, contactLastTouch, influencedContacts.

arguments.name: start_date
arguments.description: The start date for the report data in YYYY-MM-DD format. Default is 2006-01-01.

arguments.name: report_end_date
arguments.description: The end date for the report data in YYYY-MM-DD format. Defaults to the current date if not specified.

arguments.name: contact_fetch_limit
arguments.description: Specify the maximum number of contact IDs to retrieve, with a default of 100.

arguments.name: pagination_cursor
arguments.description: A string cursor for pagination to start results after the given point. Example: NTI1Cg%3D%3D

api_endpoints.description: Fetch the list of contact IDs for the specified campaign and contact type

value_schema.description:
The start date for the report data, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD.
Default value: 2006-01-01

query.description:
The start date for the report data, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD.

query.name: endDate

value_schema.description:
End date for the report data, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD.
Default value: Current date

query.description:
End date for the report data, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD.

Limit for the number of contacts to fetch

wrapper_tool.name: create_campaign_spend

description.tagline: Create a new campaign spend item for a marketing campaign.
description.detailed: This tool creates a new spend item for a specified marketing campaign. It should be called when you need to add or track expenditures related to a specific campaign.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Information about the created campaign spend item.

arguments.name: campaign_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the marketing campaign to add the spend item to.

arguments.name: spend_amount
arguments.description: The monetary value of the spend item to be added to the campaign. This should be a numerical value representing the amount in the currency used by the campaign.

arguments.name: spend_item_name
arguments.description: The name of the spend item to be created for the campaign. This should be a descriptive title or label for the expenditure.

arguments.name: spend_item_order
arguments.description: The order of the spend item in the campaign. Use an integer to specify the sequence.

arguments.name: spend_description
arguments.description: A brief description of the campaign spend item, detailing the nature or purpose of the expenditure.

api_endpoints.description: Create a new campaign spend item

path.name: campaignGuid

value_schema.description: Unique identifier for the campaign.

path.description: Unique identifier for the campaign.

api_endpoints.name: delete-/marketing/v3/forms/{formId}_archive

wrapper_tool.name: archive_marketing_form

description.tagline: Archive a marketing form in HubSpot.
description.detailed: Use this tool to archive a form in HubSpot Marketing, preventing new submissions. The form will be permanently deleted after 3 months.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Confirmation of form archive request.

arguments.name: form_id
arguments.description: The ID of the form to archive in HubSpot. This is required to process the archive request.

api_endpoints.description: Archive a form definition. New submissions will not be accepted and the form definition will be permanently deleted after 3 months.

path.name: formId

value_schema.description: The ID of the form to archive.

path.description: The ID of the form to archive.

api_endpoints.name: patch-/marketing/v3/forms/{formId}_update

wrapper_tool.name: update_hubspot_marketing_form

description.tagline: Update components of a HubSpot marketing form.
description.detailed: Use this tool to modify specific components of an existing marketing form in HubSpot by providing the form ID. Ideal for updating form details without creating a new form.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Confirmation of form update.

arguments.name: form_id
arguments.description: The unique identifier for the form to update. Must be provided to specify which form's components to update.

arguments.name: form_update_details
arguments.description: JSON object defining the components to update in the form, such as field groups, configuration settings, and display options.

api_endpoints.description: Update some of the form definition components

path.name: formId

value_schema.description: The ID of the form to update.

path.description: The ID of the form to update.

richTextType.description: The type of rich text included. The default value is text.

richText.description: A block of rich text or an image. Those can be used to add extra information for the customers filling in the form. If the field group includes fields, the rich text will be displayed before the fields.

fields.description: The form fields included in the group

fieldGroups.description: The fields in the form, grouped in rows.

createNewContactForNewEmail.description: Whether to create a new contact when a form is submitted with an email address that doesn’t match any in your existing contacts records.

editable.description: Whether the form can be edited.

allowLinkToResetKnownValues.description: Whether to add a reset link to the form. This removes any pre-populated content on the form and creates a new contact on submission.

objectTypeId.description: The objectTypeId for both contact and company

value.description: The internal name of the contact's lifecycle stage set when submitting a form

type.description: The action to take after submit. The default action is displaying a thank you message.

value.description: The thank you text or the page to redirect to.

postSubmitAction.description: What should happen after the customer submits the form.

prePopulateKnownValues.description: Whether contact fields should pre-populate with known information when a contact returns to your site.

cloneable.description: Whether the form can be cloned.

notifyContactOwner.description: Whether to send a notification email to the contact owner when a submission is received.

archivable.description: Whether the form can be archived.

notifyRecipients.description: The list of user IDs to receive a notification email when a submission is received.

name.description: The name of the form. Expected to be unique for a hub.

renderRawHtml.description: Whether the form will render as raw HTML as opposed to inside an iFrame.

theme.description: The theme used for styling the input fields. This will not apply if the form is added to a HubSpot CMS page.

submitButtonText.description: The text displayed on the form submit button.

fieldGroups.description: The fields in the form, grouped in rows.

items.description: A collection of up to three form fields usually displayed in a row.

api_endpoints.name: get-/marketing/v3/forms/_getPage

wrapper_tool.name: list_hubspot_forms

description.tagline: Retrieve a list of HubSpot marketing forms.
description.detailed: Call this tool to obtain a list of marketing forms from HubSpot. It applies search filters if provided, otherwise returns the first 20 forms by default.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: A list of HubSpot marketing forms based on search filters.

arguments.name: paging_cursor_token
arguments.description: The token indicating the cursor position for paginated results. Use `paging.next.after` from the previous response to fetch more results.

arguments.name: results_per_page
arguments.description: Specify the maximum number of forms to retrieve per page.

arguments.name: included_form_types
arguments.description: List of form types to include in results, e.g., 'hubspot', 'workflow', etc.

arguments.name: return_only_archived_forms
arguments.description: Set to true to return only archived forms in the results.

api_endpoints.description: Returns a list of forms based on the search filters. By default, it returns the first 20 `hubspot` forms

query.name: after

value_schema.description: The paging cursor token of the last successfully read resource will be returned as the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

query.description: The paging cursor token of the last successfully read resource will be returned as the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

query.name: limit

value_schema.description: The maximum number of results to display per page.

query.description: The maximum number of results to display per page.

query.name: archived

value_schema.description: Whether to return only results that have been archived.

query.description: Whether to return only results that have been archived.

query.name: formTypes

value_schema.description: The form types to be included in the results.

query.description: The form types to be included in the results.

api_endpoints.name: post-/marketing/v3/forms/_create

wrapper_tool.name: create_marketing_form

description.tagline: Create a new marketing form in HubSpot.
description.detailed: This tool is used to add a new form to HubSpot's marketing systems. It should be called whenever you need to create a new form for collecting marketing data.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Confirmation of the form creation in HubSpot.

arguments.name: form_details
arguments.description: JSON object containing the details and fields for the new HubSpot marketing form. Include title, fields, and any necessary properties.

api_endpoints.description: Add a new `hubspot` form

objectTypeId.description: A unique ID for this field's CRM object type. For example a CONTACT field will have the object type ID 0-1.

hidden.description: Whether a field should be hidden or not. Hidden fields won't appear on the form, but can be used to pass a value to a property without requiring the customer to fill it in.

defaultValue.description: The value filled in by default. This value will be submitted unless the customer modifies it.

name.description: The identifier of the field. In combination with the object type ID, it must be unique.

description.description: Additional text helping the customer to complete the field.

dependentFields.description: A list of other fields to make visible based on the value filled in for this field.

label.description: The main label for the form field.

fieldType.description: Determines how the field will be displayed and validated.

required.description: Whether a value for this field is required when submitting the form.

api_endpoints.name: get-/marketing/v3/emails/statistics/list

wrapper_tool.name: get_email_statistics

description.tagline: Get aggregated email statistics in a specified time span.
description.detailed: Use this tool to obtain aggregated statistics for emails sent within a specific time period. It also provides a list of all emails sent during that period.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Aggregated email statistics and sent email list.

api_endpoints.description: Use this endpoint to get aggregated statistics of emails sent in a specified time span. It also returns the list of emails that were sent during the time span.

wrapper_tool.name: publish_hubspot_email

description.tagline: Publish a HubSpot marketing email.
description.detailed: Use this tool to publish a marketing email in HubSpot by specifying the email ID. This should be called when you need to make an email live as part of a marketing campaign.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Confirmation of email publication in HubSpot.

arguments.name: hubspot_email_id
arguments.description: The unique identifier for the HubSpot marketing email to publish.

api_endpoints.name: post-/marketing/v3/emails/ab-test/create-variation

wrapper_tool.name: create_ab_test_email_variation

description.tagline: Create a new variation for an email A/B test.
description.detailed: Use this tool to generate a new variation of an existing email for conducting A/B tests in your marketing campaigns. This is useful for testing different email content to optimize engagement and performance.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Information about the newly created email variation.

arguments.name: variation_name
arguments.description: The name of the new email variation for the A/B test. Provide a descriptive name to easily identify this variation.

arguments.name: email_content_id
arguments.description: ID of the email content to create a variation for A/B testing.

api_endpoints.description: Create a new variation for an email A/B test

body.name: contentId

value_schema.description: ID of the object to test.

body.description: ID of the object to test.

json_schema.description: ID of the object to test.

api_endpoints.name: get-/marketing/v3/emails/statistics/histogram

wrapper_tool.name: fetch_email_statistics

description.tagline: Fetch aggregated email statistics in specified intervals.
description.detailed: This tool retrieves aggregated email statistics over specified time intervals, providing insights into email performance during each period.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Aggregated email statistics over specified intervals.

api_endpoints.description: Get aggregated statistics in intervals for a specified time span. Each interval contains aggregated statistics of the emails that were sent in that time.

api_endpoints.name: get-/marketing/v3/emails/{emailId}/ab-test/get-variation

wrapper_tool.name: get_email_ab_test_variation

description.tagline: Retrieve the variation of an A/B test marketing email.
description.detailed: Use this tool to get the opposite variation of a specified A/B marketing email. Ideal for determining the alternative version presented in a marketing email campaign.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: The variation of an A/B marketing email.

arguments.name: email_identifier
arguments.description: The unique identifier of the marketing email to obtain its A/B test variation.

api_endpoints.summary: Get the variation of a an A/B marketing email
api_endpoints.description: This endpoint lets you obtain the variation of an A/B marketing email. If the email is variation A (master) it will return variation B (variant) and vice versa.

api_endpoints.name: post-/marketing/v3/emails/{emailId}/draft/reset

wrapper_tool.name: reset_email_draft_to_live

description.tagline: Reset an email draft to match the live version.
description.detailed: Use this tool to reset an email draft to a copy of its currently live version in HubSpot Marketing. This is useful when you want to discard changes made to a draft and revert to the original published version.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Confirmation that the email draft has been reset.

arguments.name: email_id
arguments.description: The unique identifier for the email draft to be reset. This is a string value used to specify which draft to revert.

api_endpoints.description: Resets the draft back to a copy of the live object.

api_endpoints.name: post-/marketing/v3/emails/{emailId}/revisions/{revisionId}/restore-to-draft

wrapper_tool.name: restore_email_revision_to_draft

description.tagline: Restore a previous email revision to draft state.
description.detailed: Use this tool to revert a marketing email back to a previous revision, setting it to DRAFT. This will overwrite any current content in the draft for that email.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Confirmation of email revision restoration to draft status.

arguments.name: email_identifier
arguments.description: The unique identifier of the marketing email whose revision is to be restored to draft. This should match the specific email ID format used by HubSpot.

arguments.name: revision_id
arguments.description: The unique identifier of the email revision to be restored to draft state.

api_endpoints.summary: Restore a revision of a marketing email to DRAFT state
api_endpoints.description: Restores a previous revision of a marketing email to DRAFT state. If there is currently something in the draft for that object, it is overwritten.

api_endpoints.name: get-/marketing/v3/emails/{emailId}/draft

wrapper_tool.name: retrieve_email_draft

description.tagline: Retrieve the draft version of a specified email.
description.detailed: This tool retrieves the draft version of a specified email by its ID from HubSpot Marketing. If no draft exists, the published version is returned instead. It should be used when you need to access the current draft or latest version of an email.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: The draft or published version of the specified email.

arguments.name: email_id
arguments.description: The unique identifier of the email to retrieve the draft for. This ID is used to specify which email's draft or published version should be accessed.

api_endpoints.summary: Get draft version of a marketing email
api_endpoints.description: Get the draft version of an email (if it exists). If no draft version exists, the published email is returned.

api_endpoints.name: patch-/marketing/v3/emails/{emailId}/draft

wrapper_tool.name: update_email_draft

description.tagline: Create or update the draft version of a marketing email.
description.detailed: This tool creates or updates the draft version of a marketing email. If no draft exists, it creates a draft from the current live email and applies changes. Use this tool to modify email drafts before finalizing them.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Information about the updated or created email draft.

arguments.name: email_id
arguments.description: The unique identifier of the marketing email to update or create a draft for. This is required to specify which email draft you are modifying.

arguments.name: marketing_email_object
arguments.description: A JSON object representing marketing email details to update or create a draft. Includes content, subject, publish date, language, etc.

api_endpoints.description: Create or update the draft version of a marketing email. If no draft exists, the system creates a draft from the current “live” email then applies the request body to that draft. The draft version only lives on the buffer—the email is not cloned.

body.name: requestBody

rssData.description: RSS related data if it is a blog or rss email.

abSamplingDefault.description: Version of the email that should be sent if the results are inconclusive after the test period, master or variant.

abSampleSizeDefault.description: Version of the email that should be sent if there are too few recipients to conduct an AB test.

abTestPercentage.description: The size of your test group.

hoursToWait.description: Time limit on gathering test results. After this time is up, the winning version will be sent to the remaining contacts.

testId.description: The ID of the AB test.

abSuccessMetric.description: Metric to determine the version that will be sent to the remaining contacts.

testing.description: AB testing related data. This property is only returned for AB type emails.

publishDate.description: The date and time the email is scheduled for, in ISO8601 representation. This is only used in local time or scheduled emails.

content.description: Data structure representing the content of the email.

archived.description: Determines if the email is archived or not.

officeLocationId.description: ID of the selected office location.

subscriptionDetails.description: Data structure representing the subscription fields of the email.

activeDomain.description: The active domain of the email.

name.description: The name of the email, as displayed on the email dashboard.

campaign.description: The ID of the campaign this email is associated to.

customReplyTo.description: The reply to recipients will see.

replyTo.description: The from address and reply to email address (if no customReplyTo defined) recipients will see.

from.description: Data structure representing the from fields on the email.

contactIlsLists.description: Data structure representing lists of IDs that should be included and excluded.

contactIds.description: Data structure representing lists of IDs that should be included and excluded.

contactLists.description: Data structure representing lists of IDs that should be included and excluded.

to.description: Data structure representing the to fields of the email.

sendOnPublish.description: Determines whether the email will be sent immediately on publish.

api_endpoints.request_body_spec:
{
  "description": "A marketing email object with properties that should overwrite the corresponding properties in the email's current draft.",
  "content": {
    "application/json": {
      "schema": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "rssData": {
            "type": "object",
            "properties": {
              "blogImageMaxWidth": {
                "type": "integer",
                "format": "int32"
              },
              "blogEmailType": {
                "type": "string"
              },
              "hubspotBlogId": {
                "type": "string"
              },
              "rssEntryTemplate": {
                "type": "string"
              },
              "timing": {
                "type": "object",
                "additionalProperties": {
                  "type": "object",
                  "properties": {}
                }
              },
              "maxEntries": {
                "type": "integer",
                "format": "int32"
              },
              "useHeadlineAsSubject": {
                "type": "boolean"
              },
              "blogLayout": {
                "type": "string"
              },
              "url": {
                "type": "string"
              }
            },
            "description": "RSS related data if it is a blog or rss email."
          },
          "subject": {
            "type": "string",
            "description": "The subject of the email."
          },
          "testing": {
            "type": "object",
            "properties": {
              "isAbVariation": {
                "type": "boolean"
              },
              "abSamplingDefault": {
                "type": "string",
                "description": "Version of the email that should be sent if the results are inconclusive after the test period, master or variant.",
                "enum": [
                  "master",
                  "variant",
                  "loser_variant",
                  "mab_master",
                  "mab_variant",
                  "automated_master",
                  "automated_variant",
                  "automated_loser_variant"
                ]
              },
              "abSampleSizeDefault": {
                "type": "string",
                "description": "Version of the email that should be sent if there are too few recipients to conduct an AB test.",
                "enum": [
                  "master",
                  "variant",
                  "loser_variant",
                  "mab_master",
                  "mab_variant",
                  "automated_master",
                  "automated_variant",
                  "automated_loser_variant"
                ]
              },
              "abStatus": {
                "type": "string",
                "description": "Status of the AB test.",
                "enum": [
                  "master",
                  "variant",
                  "loser_variant",
                  "mab_master",
                  "mab_variant",
                  "automated_master",
                  "automated_variant",
                  "automated_loser_variant"
                ]
              },
              "abTestPercentage": {
                "type": "integer",
                "description": "The size of your test group.",
                "format": "int32"
              },
              "hoursToWait": {
                "type": "integer",
                "description": "Time limit on gathering test results. After this time is up, the winning version will be sent to the remaining contacts.",
                "format": "int32"
              },
              "testId": {
                "type": "string",
                "description": "The ID of the AB test."
              },
              "abSuccessMetric": {
                "type": "string",
                "description": "Metric to determine the version that will be sent to the remaining contacts.",
                "enum": [
                  "CLICKS_BY_OPENS",
                  "CLICKS_BY_DELIVERED",
                  "OPENS_BY_DELIVERED"
                ]
              }
            },
            "description": "AB testing related data. This property is only returned for AB type emails."
          },
          "publishDate": {
            "type": "string",
            "description": "The date and time the email is scheduled for, in ISO8601 representation. This is only used in local time or scheduled emails.",
            "format": "date-time"
          },

            "type": "string",

api_endpoints.name: get-/marketing/v3/emails/{emailId}/revisions

wrapper_tool.name: get_email_revisions

description.tagline: Retrieve all versions of a marketing email.
description.detailed: Use this tool to get a comprehensive list of all versions of a specified marketing email, each containing the full state of that version.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: List of all versions of a specific marketing email.

arguments.name: email_id
arguments.description: The unique identifier of the marketing email to retrieve revisions for.

api_endpoints.summary: Get revisions of a marketing email
api_endpoints.description: Get a list of all versions of a marketing email, with each entry including the full state of that particular version. The current revision has the ID -1.

wrapper_tool.name: unpublish_marketing_email

description.tagline: Unpublish a HubSpot marketing email.
description.detailed: This tool is used to unpublish a specific email in HubSpot Marketing. It should be called when you want to deactivate or withdraw an email from being publicly available.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Confirmation of email unpublication.

arguments.name: email_identifier
arguments.description: The unique identifier of the email you wish to unpublish in HubSpot Marketing.

api_endpoints.name: get-/marketing/v3/emails/{emailId}/revisions/{revisionId}

wrapper_tool.name: get_marketing_email_revision

description.tagline: Retrieve a specific revision of a marketing email.
description.detailed: Use this tool to get details about a specific revision of a marketing email by providing the email and revision IDs.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Details of a specific marketing email revision.

arguments.name: email_id
arguments.description: The unique identifier for the marketing email. This ID is required to specify which email's revision details to retrieve.

arguments.name: email_revision_id
arguments.description: The unique ID of the specific email revision to retrieve. Provide the revisionId for accessing the exact version.

api_endpoints.summary: Get a revision of a marketing email.
api_endpoints.description: Get a specific revision of a marketing email.

api_endpoints.name: post-/marketing/v3/emails/clone

wrapper_tool.name: clone_hubspot_email

description.tagline: Clone an existing HubSpot marketing email.
description.detailed: Use this tool to create a copy of an existing email in HubSpot's marketing platform. Ideal for reusing email templates and maintaining consistency in marketing campaigns.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Details of the newly cloned email.

arguments.name: original_email_id
arguments.description: The unique identifier of the email you wish to clone in HubSpot.

arguments.name: cloned_email_name
arguments.description: The new name for the cloned email. This should be a descriptive string to identify the copy.

arguments.name: email_language
arguments.description: Specify the language for the cloned email, e.g., 'en' for English, 'fr' for French.

api_endpoints.description: Clone an existing email

api_endpoints.name: get-/marketing/v3/emails/

wrapper_tool.name: hubspot_marketing_email_filter

description.tagline: Retrieve and filter HubSpot marketing emails.
description.detailed: Use this tool to retrieve and filter marketing emails from HubSpot. It allows you to apply various filters to find specific sets of emails based on your criteria.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Filtered list of marketing emails.

api_endpoints.summary: Get all marketing emails for a HubSpot account.
api_endpoints.description: The results can be filtered, allowing you to find a specific set of emails. See the table below for a full list of filtering options.

api_endpoints.name: post-/marketing/v3/emails/

wrapper_tool.name: create_marketing_email

description.tagline: Create a new marketing email in HubSpot.
description.detailed: Use this tool to create a new marketing email through HubSpot's marketing platform, allowing for effective email campaigns.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Confirmation of email creation with details.

arguments.name: marketing_email_details
arguments.description: JSON object containing all the details for the marketing email creation, including subject, content, scheduling, and testing options.

api_endpoints.description: Use this endpoint to create a new marketing email.

feedbackSurveyId.description: The ID of the feedback survey linked to the email.

rssData.description: RSS related data if it is a blog or rss email.

abSamplingDefault.description: Version of the email that should be sent if the results are inconclusive after the test period, master or variant.

abSampleSizeDefault.description: Version of the email that should be sent if there are too few recipients to conduct an AB test.

abTestPercentage.description: The size of your test group.

hoursToWait.description: Time limit on gathering test results. After this time is up, the winning version will be sent to the remaining contacts.

testId.description: The ID of the AB test.

abSuccessMetric.description: Metric to determine the version that will be sent to the remaining contacts.

testing.description: AB testing related data. This property is only returned for AB type emails.

publishDate.description: The date and time the email is scheduled for, in ISO8601 representation. This is only used in local time or scheduled emails.

content.description: Data structure representing the content of the email.

archived.description: Determines if the email is archived or not.

officeLocationId.description: ID of the selected office location.

subscriptionDetails.description: Data structure representing the subscription fields of the email.

activeDomain.description: The active domain of the email.

name.description: The name of the email, as displayed on the email dashboard.

campaign.description: The ID of the campaign this email is associated to.

customReplyTo.description: The reply to recipients will see.

replyTo.description: The from address and reply to email address (if no customReplyTo defined) recipients will see.

from.description: Data structure representing the from fields on the email.

contactIlsLists.description: Data structure representing lists of IDs that should be included and excluded.

contactIds.description: Data structure representing lists of IDs that should be included and excluded.

contactLists.description: Data structure representing lists of IDs that should be included and excluded.

to.description: Data structure representing the to fields of the email.

sendOnPublish.description: Determines whether the email will be sent immediately on publish.

Introduce yourself and explain why you\u2019re reaching out.\n\nEvery email should try to lead the reader to some kind of action. Use this space to describe why the reader should want to click on the link below. api_endpoints.name: post-/marketing/v3/emails/{emailId}/revisions/{revisionId}/restore

wrapper_tool.name: restore_email_revision

description.tagline: Restore a previous revision of a marketing email.
description.detailed: Use this tool to revert a marketing email to a specified previous revision. The current version is archived, and the restored revision is assigned a new version number.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Confirmation of email revision restoration.

arguments.name: email_id
arguments.description: The unique identifier for the marketing email you want to restore. This ID is required to specify which email's revision needs restoration.

arguments.name: revision_id
arguments.description: The unique identifier for the specific revision of the email to be restored.

api_endpoints.summary: Restore a revision of a marketing email
api_endpoints.description: Restores a previous revision of a marketing email. The current revision becomes old, and the restored revision is given a new version number.

api_endpoints.name: get-/marketing/v3/emails/{emailId}

wrapper_tool.name: get_marketing_email_details

description.tagline: Retrieve details for a specific marketing email.
description.detailed: Use this tool to get comprehensive information about a marketing email by specifying its email ID.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Details of a specific marketing email.

arguments.name: email_id
arguments.description: The unique identifier for the specific marketing email. Required to retrieve email details.

api_endpoints.summary: Get the details of a specified marketing email.
api_endpoints.description: Get the details for a marketing email.

api_endpoints.name: delete-/marketing/v3/emails/{emailId}

wrapper_tool.name: delete_marketing_email

description.tagline: Delete an existing marketing email by ID.
description.detailed: Use this tool to remove a specific marketing email from the HubSpot system by providing its unique email ID. This is useful for managing email lists and ensuring outdated or incorrect emails are removed.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Confirmation of email deletion.

arguments.name: email_id
arguments.description: The unique ID of the marketing email to be deleted.

api_endpoints.description: Delete an existing marketing email.

api_endpoints.name: patch-/marketing/v3/emails/{emailId}

wrapper_tool.name: update_marketing_email_properties

description.tagline: Change properties of a marketing email.
description.detailed: Use this tool to update properties of an existing marketing email by specifying the email ID. It helps in modifying content or settings of your marketing campaigns.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Updated marketing email details.

arguments.name: email_identifier
arguments.description: The unique identifier of the marketing email to be updated. Required to specify which email's properties are being changed.

arguments.name: email_properties
arguments.description: JSON object containing fields to update in the marketing email, like subject, content, A/B testing info, etc.

api_endpoints.description: Change properties of a marketing email.

body.name: requestBody

rssData.description: RSS related data if it is a blog or rss email.

abSamplingDefault.description: Version of the email that should be sent if the results are inconclusive after the test period, master or variant.

abSampleSizeDefault.description: Version of the email that should be sent if there are too few recipients to conduct an AB test.

abTestPercentage.description: The size of your test group.

hoursToWait.description: Time limit on gathering test results. After this time is up, the winning version will be sent to the remaining contacts.

testId.description: The ID of the AB test.

abSuccessMetric.description: Metric to determine the version that will be sent to the remaining contacts.

testing.description: AB testing related data. This property is only returned for AB type emails.

publishDate.description: The date and time the email is scheduled for, in ISO8601 representation. This is only used in local time or scheduled emails.

content.description: Data structure representing the content of the email.

archived.description: Determines if the email is archived or not.

officeLocationId.description: ID of the selected office location.

subscriptionDetails.description: Data structure representing the subscription fields of the email.

activeDomain.description: The active domain of the email.

name.description: The name of the email, as displayed on the email dashboard.

campaign.description: The ID of the campaign this email is associated to.

customReplyTo.description: The reply to recipients will see.

replyTo.description: The from address and reply to email address (if no customReplyTo defined) recipients will see.

description.tagline: Retrieve participations breakdown for a specific marketing event.
description.detailed: This tool fetches a detailed breakdown of participations for a specific marketing event identified by marketingEventId. It can be used to analyze participation metrics and insights for a given event.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Breakdown of participations for a marketing event.

It is useful for updating contact records and timelines when contacts attend an event. The tool supports additional properties like 'joinedAt' and 'leftAt' for the 'attend' state.

arguments.name: external_account_id
arguments.description: The ID identifying the account associated with the marketing event in the external application.

api_endpoints.description:
Records the participation of multiple HubSpot contacts in a Marketing Event using their HubSpot contact IDs.

Additional Functionality:
- Adds a timeline event to the contacts.

Allowed Properties:
For the state "attend":
- joinedAt
- leftAt

api_endpoints.summary: Create or update a marketing event
api_endpoints.description: Upserts a marketing event If there is an existing marketing event with the specified ID, it will be updated; otherwise a new event will be created.

value_schema.description: The id of the marketing event in the external event application

startDateTime.description: The start date and time of the marketing event.

customProperties.description:
A list of PropertyValues. These can be whatever kind of property names and values you want. However, they must already exist on the HubSpot account's definition of the MarketingEvent Object. If they don't they will be filtered out and not set.
In order to do this you'll need to create a new PropertyGroup on the HubSpot account's MarketingEvent object for your specific app and create the Custom Property you want to track on that HubSpot account. Do not create any new default properties on the MarketingEvent object as that will apply to all HubSpot accounts.

externalAccountId.description: The accountId that is associated with this marketing event in the external event application.

eventCancelled.description: Indicates if the marketing event has been cancelled.  Defaults to `false`

eventOrganizer.description: The name of the organizer of the marketing event.

eventUrl.description: A URL in the external event application where the marketing event can be managed.

externalEventId.description: The id of the marketing event in the external event application.

eventDescription.description: The description of the marketing event.

eventName.description: The name of the marketing event.

eventType.description: Describes what type of event this is.  For example: `WEBINAR`, `CONFERENCE`, `WORKSHOP`

endDateTime.description: The end date and time of the marketing event.

startDateTime.description: The start date and time of the marketing event.

customProperties.description:
A list of PropertyValues. These can be whatever kind of property names and values you want. However, they must already exist on the HubSpot account's definition of the MarketingEvent Object. If they don't they will be filtered out and not set.
In order to do this you'll need to create a new PropertyGroup on the HubSpot account's MarketingEvent object for your specific app and create the Custom Property you want to track on that HubSpot account. Do not create any new default properties on the MarketingEvent object as that will apply to all HubSpot accounts.

description.tagline: Record participation of contacts in a HubSpot marketing event.
description.detailed: Use this tool to record the attendance of HubSpot contacts in a marketing event using their email addresses. It can automatically create contacts if they do not exist and adds a timeline event for them. This is particularly useful for logging who attended or participated in specific marketing events.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Confirmation of participation recording in HubSpot.

arguments.description: The ID of the marketing event in the external event application.

arguments.description: JSON object containing details of contacts, including email, properties, and interaction date/time for marketing event participation.

arguments.name: external_account_id
arguments.description: The account ID linked to the marketing event in the external event application.

api_endpoints.summary: Record Participants by Email with Marketing Event External Ids
api_endpoints.description:
Records the participation of multiple HubSpot contacts in a Marketing Event using their email addresses.

If a contact does not exist, it will be automatically created. The contactProperties field is used exclusively for creating new contacts and will not update properties of existing contacts.

Additional Functionality:
- Adds a timeline event to the contacts.

Allowed Properties:
For the state "attend":
- joinedAt
- leftAt

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Confirmation of marketing event creation.

arguments.name: marketing_event_details

customProperties.description:
A list of PropertyValues. These can be whatever kind of property names and values you want. However, they must already exist on the HubSpot account's definition of the MarketingEvent Object. If they don't they will be filtered out and not set.
In order to do this you'll need to create a new PropertyGroup on the HubSpot account's MarketingEvent object for your specific app and create the Custom Property you want to track on that HubSpot account. Do not create any new default properties on the MarketingEvent object as that will apply to all HubSpot accounts.

externalAccountId.description: The accountId that is associated with this marketing event in the external event application.

eventCancelled.description: Indicates if the marketing event has been cancelled.  Defaults to `false`

eventOrganizer.description: The name of the organizer of the marketing event.

eventUrl.description: A URL in the external event application where the marketing event can be managed.

externalEventId.description: The id of the marketing event in the external event application.

eventDescription.description: The description of the marketing event.

eventName.description: The name of the marketing event.

eventType.description: Describes what type of event this is.  For example: `WEBINAR`, `CONFERENCE`, `WORKSHOP`

endDateTime.description: The end date and time of the marketing event.

startDateTime.description: The start date and time of the marketing event.

wrapper_tool.name: get_contact_participations_breakdown

description.tagline: Retrieve a contact's event participation details by ID or email.
description.detailed: This tool retrieves participation details for a specific contact in marketing events using their email or internal ID. It is useful for analyzing a contact's engagement in various events.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Contact's event participation details.

arguments.name: contact_identifier
arguments.description: The identifier of the contact, which can be either an email or an internal ID.

arguments.name: participation_state
arguments.description: The participation state for the contact. Options: REGISTERED, CANCELLED, ATTENDED, NO_SHOW.

arguments.name: response_size_limit
arguments.description: Specify the maximum number of participation records to return. The default is 10, and the maximum is 100.

arguments.name: pagination_cursor
arguments.description: Cursor for the last retrieved item to manage pagination.

api_endpoints.summary: Read participations breakdown by Contact identifier
api_endpoints.description: Read Contact's participations by identifier - email or internal id.

query.description: The participation state value. It may be REGISTERED, CANCELLED, ATTENDED, NO_SHOW

query.name: limit

value_schema.description: The limit for response size. The default value is 10, the max number is 100

query.description: The limit for response size. The default value is 10, the max number is 100

query.name: after

value_schema.description: The cursor indicating the position of the last retrieved item.

query.description: The cursor indicating the position of the last retrieved item.

value_schema.description: The identifier of the Contact. It may be email or internal id.

path.description: The identifier of the Contact. It may be email or internal id.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Details of marketing events matching the specified ID.

arguments.name: external_event_id
arguments.description: The ID of the marketing event in the external application (externalEventId) to search for.

api_endpoints.summary: Find App-Specific Marketing Events by External Event Id
api_endpoints.description:
Retrieves Marketing Events where the externalEventId matches the value provided in the request, limited to events created by the app making the request.

Marketing Events created by other apps will not be included in the results.

query.name: q

value_schema.description: The id of the marketing event in the external event application (externalEventId)

api_endpoints.name: post-/marketing/v4/email/single-send

wrapper_tool.name: send_marketing_email

description.tagline: Send a template email to a specific recipient.
description.detailed: This tool sends a marketing email using a predefined template to a specified recipient via HubSpot. It's useful for automating email campaigns and reaching target audiences efficiently.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Confirmation of email being sent successfully.

arguments.name: email_content_data
arguments.description: A JSON object containing email ID, message details, custom properties, and contact properties for sending a marketing email.

api_endpoints.description: Send a template email to a specific recipient.

customProperties.description:
The customProperties field is a map of property values. Each property value contains a name and value property. Each property will be visible in the template under {{ custom.NAME }}.
Note: Custom properties do not currently support arrays. To provide a listing in an email, one workaround is to build an HTML list (either with tables or ul) and specify it as a custom property.

emailId.description: The content ID for the email, which can be found in email tool UI.

cc.description: List of email addresses to send as Cc.

sendId.description: ID for a particular send. No more than one email will be sent per sendId.

bcc.description: List of email addresses to send as Bcc.

replyTo.description: List of Reply-To header values for the email.

from.description: The From header for the email.

message.description: A JSON object containing anything you want to override.

contactProperties.description: The contactProperties field is a map of contact property values. Each contact property value contains a name and value property. Each property will get set on the contact record and will be visible in the template under {{ contact.NAME }}. Use these properties when you want to set a contact property while you’re sending the email. For example, when sending a receipt you may want to set a last_paid_date property, as the sending of the receipt will have information about the last payment.

json_schema.description: A request to send a single email asynchronously.

Note: Custom properties do not currently support arrays. To provide a listing in an email, one workaround is to build an HTML list (either with tables or ul) and specify it as a custom property.

emailId.description: The content ID for the email, which can be found in email tool UI.

Use these properties when you want to set a contact property while you’re sending the email. For example, when sending a receipt you may want to set a last_paid_date property, as the sending of the receipt will have information about the last payment.

wrapper_tool.name: create_smtp_api_token

description.tagline: Creates a SMTP API token for transaction emails.
description.detailed: This tool is used to create a new SMTP API token for sending transactional emails through HubSpot's marketing service. It should be called when a new token is needed for email operations.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: SMTP API token creation confirmation.

arguments.name: campaign_name
arguments.description: The name of the campaign associated with the SMTP API token.

arguments.name: create_contact_for_recipients
arguments.description: Indicates whether a contact should be created for email recipients. Set to true to create a contact.

api_endpoints.description: Create a SMTP API token.

body.name: createContact

value_schema.description: Indicates whether a contact should be created for email recipients.

body.description: Indicates whether a contact should be created for email recipients.

json_schema.description: Indicates whether a contact should be created for email recipients.

body.name: campaignName

value_schema.description: A name for the campaign tied to the SMTP API token.

body.description: A name for the campaign tied to the SMTP API token.

json_schema.description: A name for the campaign tied to the SMTP API token.

api_endpoints.name: post-/marketing/v3/transactional/smtp-tokens/{tokenId}/password-reset_resetPassword

wrapper_tool.name: reset_password_for_token

description.tagline: Resets the password for a specified token.
description.detailed: This tool allows you to create a new password for a specified token, invalidating the old password. Use it when you need to reset the password associated with a specific SMTP token in HubSpot's marketing system.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Confirmation of password reset for the token.

arguments.name: token_identifier
arguments.description: The unique string identifier for the token, used to reset its password.

api_endpoints.summary: Reset the password of an existing token.
api_endpoints.description: Allows the creation of a replacement password for a given token. Once the password is successfully reset, the old password for the token will be invalid.

path.name: tokenId

value_schema.description: Identifier generated when a token is created.

path.description: Identifier generated when a token is created.

api_endpoints.name: get-/marketing/v3/transactional/smtp-tokens/{tokenId}_getTokenById

wrapper_tool.name: get_smtp_token_by_id

description.tagline: Retrieve details of an SMTP token using its ID.
description.detailed: This tool is used to query a specific SMTP token by its ID within the HubSpot Marketing platform. Call this tool when you need to access detailed information about a particular SMTP transactional token.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Details of the SMTP token queried by ID.

arguments.name: smtp_token_id
arguments.description: The unique identifier of the SMTP token to be queried.

api_endpoints.summary: Query a single token by ID.
api_endpoints.description: Query a single token by ID.

path.name: tokenId

value_schema.description: Identifier generated when a token is created.

path.description: Identifier generated when a token is created.

api_endpoints.name: delete-/marketing/v3/transactional/smtp-tokens/{tokenId}_archiveToken

wrapper_tool.name: delete_smtp_token

description.tagline: Delete an SMTP token by ID in HubSpot Marketing.
description.detailed: Use this tool to delete a specific SMTP token from HubSpot Marketing by providing the token ID. This is useful for managing and revoking access tokens when they are no longer needed or for security reasons.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Confirmation of token deletion.

arguments.name: smtp_token_id
arguments.description: The unique identifier of the SMTP token to be deleted, provided during token creation.

api_endpoints.summary: Delete a single token by ID.
api_endpoints.description: Delete a single token by ID.

value_schema.description: Identifier generated when a token is created.

path.description: Identifier generated when a token is created.
